title.narrative: Environmentally Sound Management of Medical Wastes in India

description.narrative: A detailed situation analysis was carried out during the project preparatory phase in 5 selected states in India namely Gujarat, Kar nataka, Maharashtra, Punjab and Orissa covering medical waste management in healthcare facilities (HCFs) and Common Biomedical Waste Treatment Facilities (CBWTFs). In the situation analysis carried out among 57 CBWTFs, which is 40% of total CBWTFs in the country, the amount of PCDD/F emission was estimated to be 105.44 g I-TEQ/y using the UNEP Toolkit. If the same is extrapolated to the country, it will be 263.6 g I-TEQ/y PCDD/F releases. By proper segregation and either by applying non-incineration techniques or upgrading existing incinerators in the 57 CBWTFs, 50.7 g I-TEQ/y PCDD/F reduction can be achieved. Extrapolating this to the whole country, 126.75 g I-TEQ/y PCDD/F reduction can be achieved. Based on the above figures of the survey and with the successful implementation of the project, the estimated cost of avoided PCDD/F emissions would be US$ 7.6 million per year in 5 selected states, indicating high cost effectiveness of the project. The proposed project will promote country-wide adoption of best available techniques/best environmental practices (BAT/BEP) in healthcare institutions of widely differing in their complexity and size, as well as in the evolving medical wa
